definition:
A ring $R$ satisfies the *left Ore condition* (resp. *right Ore
condition*) if and only if for all elements $x$ and $y$ with $x$
regular, there exist elements $u$ and $v$ with $v$ regular such that
$$ux = vy \quad\text{(resp.} xu = yv\text{).}$$

A ring which satisfies the (left, right) Ore condition is called a
(*left*, *right*) *Ore ring*.
